plausible_answers.text: Lord Wellesley and the Marquis of Hastings

qas.question: Who lost all control over India?
What events had the least amount of expenses?

context: The aggressive policies of <a0_0><b5_0><b7_0>Lord Wellesley<b5_0/><a0_0/> and the Marquis of Hastings<b7_0/> led to <b8_0>the Company<b8_0/> gaining control of all India (except for the Punjab and <a1_0>Sindh<a1_0/>), and some part of the then kingdom of Nepal under the <a3_0>Sugauli Treaty<a3_0/>. The Indian Princes had become vassals of the Company. But <a2_0>the expense of <b9_0>wars<b9_0/><a2_0/> leading to the total control of India strained the Company's finances. The Company was forced to petition Parliament for assistance. This was the background to the <a4_0>Charter Act of <b6_0>1813<b6_0/><a4_0/> which, among other things:
